A: 1. Highway codes help us stay _ on the roads (a) safe (b) fast (c) happy
2. Highway codes are rules for road _ (a) safety (b) speed (c) fun
3. Before crossing the road, look left, then _, then left again (a) right (b) up (c) down
4. We should use _ to cross the road (a) crosswalks (b) bushes (c) rivers
5. When walking on the road, hold someone's _ (a) hand (b) bag (c) hat
6. Wear bright colors so drivers can _ you (a) see (b) hear (c) smell
7. The red traffic light means _ (a) Stop (b) Go (c) Wait
8. The green traffic light means _ (a) Go (b) Stop (c) Wait
9. The yellow traffic light means get ready to _ (a) stop (b) go (c) play
10. Highway codes _ lives on our roads (a) safeguard (b) destroy (c) ignore
11. Highway codes help promote _ use of the roads (a) orderly (b) chaotic (c) random
12. Highway codes _ drivers and cyclists on proper use of roads (a) guide (b) confuse (c) distract
13. Highway codes help ensure _ drivers are punished (a) reckless (b) careful (c) slow
14. A Pedestrian Crossing is also known as a _ Crossing (a) Zebra (b) Tiger (c) Lion
15. At a Pedestrian Crossing, all vehicles should _ (a) stop (b) speed up (c) turn
16. The "No Entry" sign informs road users they are on the _ way (a) wrong (b) right (c) main
17. The "No Entry" sign helps to indicate a road is _ way only (a) one (b) two (c) three
18. Security refers to _ (a) safety (b) danger (c) fear
19. Security is protection from _ to life and property (a) dangers (b) gifts (c) friends
20. Security is important for the _ of any nation (a) development (b) decline (c) delay
B: 1. What helps us stay safe on the roads?_________
2. What should you use to cross the road?_________
4. What sign tells vehicles to stop for pedestrians?_________
5. What is protection from dangers to life and property called?_________
C: 3. Name one benefit of highway codes.
4. What does the "No Entry" sign indicate?
answers_C: Rules, regulations, and symbols for road safety.
Look Left, Right and Left Again.
It indicates a wrong way or a one-way road.
Safety, well-being, freedom, and peace; protection from dangers.
